snippet: Bach at One and its new offshoot, Pipes at One, opened the season last week at St. Paul’s Chapel, part of Trinity Church.
abstract: James R Oestreich lauds return of Bach at One, a midday series of hourlong concerts that are part of Trinity Wall Street's music program, and new offshoot Pipes at One, at St Paul's Chapel in Lower Manhattan; says that series and much of Trinity's programming seemed endangered early in 2012 as church reevaluated its purposes and costs.
lead_paragraph: Bach at One and its new offshoot, Pipes at One, opened the season last week at St. Paul’s Chapel, part of Trinity Church.

headline.seo: Bach at One and Pipes at One at Trinity’s St. Paul’s Chapel
headline.main: Keeping Up the Spirit of Bach and Carrying On
headline.print_headline: Keeping Up the Spirit of Bach and Carrying On
